title.narrative: Strategic Partnership 2019-2023

description.narrative: Multiannual strategic partnership between the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Government of the Netherlands and the International Crisis Group (CG) which supports CG in its mission of global conflict prevention and resolution activities. The partnership provides the MFA with valued activities in priority conflict situations within the MFA’s result framework.

recipient-region.narrative: Crisis Group’s provides analysis and advice on how to prevent, resolve or better manage deadly conflict through independent research, concrete policy prescriptions for conflict prevention and by shaping the international debate. The Strategic Partnership 2019-2023 between the MFA and International Crisis Group consists of two components: Core support to Crisis Group's conflict prevention and resolution activities and earmarked support of the Government of the Netherlands for engagement on a range of priority conflicts and Early Warning for certain priority contexts.

provider-org.narrative: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Netherlands
Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Netherlands

Actions taken, including revised policies, to prevent, manage or resolve the crisis/conflict, that reflect Crisis Group policy recommendations

description.narrative: Crisis Group's mission and work correspond with: - the long-term MFA's intended outcome number 3 on Peace process & Political Governance; - Cross cutting outcome number 1 on more informed (evidence-based) policy & increased conflict-sensitivity and - MFA's mid-term outcomes (2.1,3.1, 3.2) and outputs approches (2.1.3, 3.1.2, 3.1.3, 3.2.2, and 3.2.3)

title.narrative: Some 5000 private briefings and meetings for key conflict stakeholders in both program countries and policy centres
Number of advocacy and public awareness events (including roundtables, seminars, private briefings, etc)

comment.narrative: More than 2,000 oral briefings for senior officials, diplomatic representatives, lawmakers and others, in both Program countries and key capitals, as a means of drawing attention to and engaging in discussion about our research findings and policy recommendations.
Over 1,000 oral briefings for senior officials, diplomatic representatives, lawmakers and others, in both program countries and key capitals.

title.narrative: 48 issues of CrisisWatch

Number of Crisis Group's monthly global conflict tracker summarising the state of play of conflict or potential conflict around the world, and identifying risks of deterioration and opportunities for progress.
Up to 500 commentaries, op-eds, statements, conflict alerts, fast-reaction Q&As, photographic essays, videos, infographics, interactive maps.
Number of short published pieces and multimedia outputs
Up to 150 detailed analytical reports/briefing, including practical policy recommendations
Number of published Crisis Group reports/briefings providing analysis and actionable policy prescriptions
Ongoing media outreach, including through social media.
